resources.string: Something went wrong: Couldn\'t delete file
No filemanager found: Please install one
This service runs Cuberite and ensures that it is not killed by the system.
This service downloads, unzips and installs Cuberite.

Cuberite stores it\'s worlds by default on the external storage, which is readable and writable by any app. For this, you need to allow Cuberite to write to the external storage. If you don\'t want to give the necessary permission, please select the \"don\'t ask again\" option and Cuberite will use the apps private storage.

SHA-1 sums doesn\'t match. This can indicate someone trying to spoof you or just a download error. Please retry and if the error persists, you may turn off the check by installing Cuberite via the Settings

The server from which Cuberite will download from. If you are running your own (automated) builds, you can change this setting and Cuberite will use your own server. Please note, that in order to have working automatic updates, the server needs to provide valid SHA-1 files

An automatic Cuberite updater is yet to be done, use this section from time to time to update your installation of Cuberite. Please note that if you perform a server.zip update this may overwrite custom server settings.
Instead of downloading Cuberite you can choose to use your own compiled binaries. Use this only if you understand what you are doing.
Select and install binary zip file

Normally, Cuberite verifies the downloaded executables to make sure Cuberite was downloaded correctly. Use this button if the verification fails, but note that you are disabling a security feature by that.
For fine-tuning your server, you are entitled to use the built-in Webadmin. Use the settings here to set a username and password for it
Before setting the Webadmin credentials, Cuberite needs to be installed before. You can either choose to install it now or just close this dialog
Something went wrong while accessing the Webadmin configuration
Success! The new credentials are activated when you start Cuberite the next time

On some devices the authentication with Mojang servers doesn\'t work, we know the problem but haven\'t been able to fix it yet. If you have troubles connecting to Cuberite and get the message \"Failed to authenticate!\", you might want to disable authentication using the button below.
Something went wrong while accessing the Server configuration
Success! Authentication is now %1$s! Restart the server to activate the change
